protocol.text: Arabidopsis thaliana (accession Col-0) and the des1-1 mutant (SALK_03855) were grown in soil supplemented with Hoagland media. Plants were grown under a photoperiod of 16 h of white light (120 μE m-2 s-1) at 20ºC and 8 h dark at 18ºC.

The leaves of 3-week-old plants were collected and RNA extracted from each sample. Total RNA was isolated with Trizol reagent (Invitrogen) followed by cleaning with the RNeasy Plant Mini Kit (Qiagen).
Biotinylated cRNA was prepared according to the standard Affymetrix protocol from 4 µg total RNA (Expression Analysis Technical Manual, 2001, Affymetrix).

Following fragmentation, 15 µg of biotinylated cRNA were hybridized to Affymetrix chips (GeneChip Arabidopsis ATH1 Genome Array). Each sample was added to a hybridization solution containing 100mM 2-(N-morpholino)ethanesulfonic acid, 1 M Na+, and 20mM of EDT
GeneChips were scanned using the Affymetrix GeneChip Scanner 3000 7G
GeneChip intensities were background-corrected, normalized and sumarized by RMA method, using the “Affy” package from Bioconductor.
